alert.note: Alert for John Day Basin (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 3:53PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Grant County through 430 PM PDT... At 352 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout 7 miles east of Monument, or 33 miles northwest of John Day, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Landspout possible, winds in excess of 30 mph, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ritter and Hamilton. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
